intro: Begonia crinita, commonly known as the hairpin begonia, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its long, curly leaves that resemble hairpins, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Begonia crinita is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and vibrant floral display.
